title: 103_s1651
content:
The Act is titled the "United States Military Academy Bicentennial Commemorative Coin Act of 1993". It specifies the coin specifications. The Act titled "United States Military Academy Bicentennial Commemorative Coin Act of 1993" specifies the issuance of $5 gold coins and $1 silver coins with specific weights, diameters, and designs emblematic of the United States Military Academy. The Act specifies the issuance of $1 coins with specific weights, diameters, and designs emblematic of the United States Military Academy. Additionally, half dollar clad coins will also be issued with specific weights and diameters. The Act specifies the issuance of $1 coins and half dollar coins with designs emblematic of the United States Military Academy. The coins shall bear inscriptions of the year "2002", "Liberty", "In God We Trust", "United States of America", and "E Pluribus Unum", and shall be legal tender. The Secretary will obtain silver bullion from stockpiles under the Strategic and Critical Materials Stock Piling Act and gold bullion under existing law for coins minted under this Act. The design for each coin will be selected by the Secretary in consultation with various groups, and the coins will be issued as legal tender with specific inscriptions. SEC. 5. ISSUANCE OF THE COINS.

The $5 gold coins will be minted in uncirculated and proof qualities at the United States Bullion Depository at West Point. The $1 coins and half dollar coins will also be issued in uncirculated and proof qualities, with a limit of 1 facility for striking each denomination and quality. The coins will be available for issue by March 16, 2002, and no coins will be minted after December 31, 2002.

SEC. 6. SALE OF THE COINS. The coins issued under this Act will be sold by the Secretary at a price including face value, surcharge, and cost of designing and issuing. Bulk sales will be offered at a discount, and prepaid orders will be accepted. A surcharge is required for each coin sold. SEC. 7. GENERAL WAIVER OF PROCUREMENT REGULATIONS. No procurement laws apply to goods/services for this Act. Compliance with equal employment laws is required for contracts under this Act. SEC. 8. DISTRIBUTION OF SURCHARGES. Surcharges from coin sales go to the Association of Graduates, US Military Academy. SEC. 9. AUDITS. SEC. 9. AUDITS. The Comptroller General of the United States can examine the Association of Graduates, US Military Academy's records related to expenditures. SEC. 10. NUMISMATIC PUBLIC ENTERPRISE FUND. Coins issued under this Act are subject to section 5134 of title 31, US Code. SEC. 11. FINANCIAL ASSURANCES. SEC. 11. FINANCIAL ASSURANCES. The Secretary must ensure no net cost to the government for issuing coins authorized by this Act. Adequate security for payment is required before issuing any coin.
